summary: (So I make puppets and I was thinking about making a Peter Porker puppet since I haven’t made a fanart puppet before and... this...
caption:
(So I make puppets and I was thinking about making a Peter Porker puppet since I haven’t made a fanart puppet before and… this is how I plan puppets and I thought I’d show it because it’s basically me throwing all my ideas onto a page.)

(Also there’s more of my rambling under the cut if anyone was curious) 

(Anyways I was planning to make Ham a rod puppet. Think like Kermit is a rod puppet that sort of thing. The big issue with this puppet though is how to structure it. And what I mean by that is how do I still have his head proportions be right without restricting his mouth from moving. So, basically I can’t have his lower jaw attached to the rest of his head outside of the mouth plate and neck to make sure it all still works properly.)

(I was also planning to give him inset eyes but I was planning to make that an entirely new piece of foam and his pupils be felt or something so it still has the cartoony look. Since I really don’t want to accidentally make this terrifying oisrhsorg)

(And if anyone was wondering his build would be similar to this puppet. They don’t have a name yet but this is the most recent rod puppet I have made. They’re still a wip though)

(Also god it’s hard to get a decent photo of this on my own shsrggsru)

(So I make puppets and I was thinking about making a Peter Porker puppet since I haven’t made a fanart puppet before and… this is how I plan puppets and I thought I’d show it because it’s basically me throwing all my ideas onto a page.)

blog.name: pyrot3ch-nick
blog.title: Engineering Fireworks
blog.description:
I'm Nick. I also go by Nico.
Currently DMing worlds where newsies have heroic arcane powers and where the gods walk among us.
I'm bi, latino, and studying mechs

body:
David on Twitter

“In the 1970’s, publisher La Prensa did not believe Mexicans would read Spider-man after Gwen Stacy died. They created 45 original issues after Spiderman 119 where she lives, that have never been translated or reprinted. This is their marriage issue. Marvel needs to collect these! https://t.co/dx2z6NO5JX”

While a lot of classical Mexican literature and songs pieces have sad and bittersweet stories and endings, that didn’t really extend into new media like radio drama, comics books, and television.

reblog.comment:
